tweets.text:
At Health Questions I asked @MattHancock about the public health implications of the breaches at Walley's Quarry.

I know, from both the local GPs and those writing to me, that many residents are concerned for their health, both physically and mentally. @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/pwh6zUI4Zs

tweets.text: Westlands is full of landfill gas again, starting to smell it in the house again so likely in for another night of health effects & no sleep. Shame on you @EnvAgency and your duplicity in this outrage on our health. Shame on you @PHE_EoEngland for not protecting our health

Thank you Aaron. @MattHancock please do not let this slide like @EnvAgencyMids have. It’s not just a ‘smell’.It is toxic landfill gases entering homes whilst we sleep! I have no pre existing conditions and sometimes after a bad night I wake up with my lungs burning! #stopthestink https://t.co/mbKE9wZiIt

tweets.text: @SianieRoo @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland is terrible in Trent vale again as well.
@MrNickKnowles @SianieRoo @EnvAgency @WHO @The_RHS Last one mate, have a look at this video. https://t.co/V5KOJPTXe5

@KevinDeakin11 @StinkStopthe Same here. Im actually finding myself not wanting to move around the house in fear the next room will be worse with the smell. What is this life @EnvAgencyMids !!! @RedIndustries2 shame on you #stopthestink

Please we need national awareness of the failings of @EnvAgencyMids and @RedIndustries2 as well as @PHE_uk . Our MP has raised the matter in parliament , people are genuinely getting mentally and physically ill through this . @NadaFarhoud @rincon_p @StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off

Anyone know why builders at Mitcham Bridge are dumping waste into the River Wandle? I recorded this today at 3:15. #wandle @EnvAgencySE  @EnvAgency @riverlevel_2135 @Merton_Council https://t.co/czmoLpKGHd

The air purifiers have started to go out to people in need. @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency  Look at this poor woman's eyes! This cannot be allowed to go on. Hang your heads in shame #capitoff #stopthestink https://t.co/g7kUIqLdzd

Great job by @joe_crowley on sewage discharges on Panorama last evening. Shame the @EnvAgency declined to appear, too many difficult questions to answer, what does EA stand for "Evasive, Always".

https://t.co/a5vQAo5gNL

I know you have likely had your fill of the landfill.  But a retweet of this post would be amazing if your would oblige.

The pollution we are putting up with is wrong on any level.  A mile away and it stinks.

tweets.text:
All answers on a postcard or even Tweeter, DM etc. 

Don't forget to mention the @EnvAgency and the endless Kms of rivers they "Enhance". What does that mean?

Obviously add the water industry and the supposed £5Bn spend on the environment. What exactly is that spent on? https://t.co/j3IAIzYXEU

@Vig79 @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgencySE @EnvAgency @riverlevel_2135 @Merton_Council It’s a requirement to obtain a temporary consent to discharge from EA. That will stipulate volume and type of discharge allowed. Highly likely they will need to pass it through some settlement process to remove particulate solids such as soils/clay etc.

@AaronBell4NUL @MattHancock @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids Well I hope Hancock is actually listening and not just placating. Those affected by this disgusting smell have been battling for a long time apparently but not much has been done.  Imagine living with smells in your house constantly and the affect on their health.

@save_our_fields I am terribly sorry. Thank you for doing your best. This Government is just against the preservation of wildlife - this is their disgrace and that of the local council. Shame on you @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @pow_rebecca @MPGeorgeEustice @AvantHomes
